Removed excess formatting.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
Love this idea

I like this suggestion. This is something I've always wanted for a while, but you know, I couldn't find the right words to explain it. However, I believe that certain adjustments have to be made to horses since such a feature would make cavalry combat unstoppable vs players on foot unless you do something like an infantry square lol.

Implement a stamina feature OR give horses their own hunger bar

  • Whichever works best, the goal is to create a penalty for riding a horse too long.
  • Giving horses a stamina feature warrants a new attribute similar to the likes of speed and jump, or it could rely on another attribute such as max health. Perhaps the horse can become exhausted if ridden for more than x minutes, where x is the horse's max health or stamina value.
  • Giving horses their own hunger bar is an alternative to stamina, and might give purpose to the useless feeding animation now that they have a reason to eat grass. If their hunger is low, the horse cannot move at full speed, similar to players' sprint.
  • If a horse is dying from hunger, there must be a unique damage sound or animation. It shouldn't be confused with other effects like Wither or Poison.
  • Adding a hunger bar for horses might demand consistency to add this feature to every other animal, but from a lore perspective this merely demonstrates the bond between player and horse.

Horses shouldn't be able to do sharp turns without losing momentum

  • Yaw turns should be done in a manner similar to boats.

Absolutely. I know horses in real life can strafe but it feels a little janky in minecraft. Imagine riding across the savanna on horseback while being able to look around and enjoy the view. I should be able to tilt my head to the side and do drive by attacking without losing momentum with a horse just like on boats. The only downside of riding horseback would then be the inability to strafe (and water). The devs could copy/paste the boat controls into horse controls.

I think it would make horse riding more enjoyable. Riding along the plains. Circling mobs while attacking. Falling into holes because we were looking at that mountain in the distance.
I've also been saying this for awhile, and now that we're getting new mounts this should definitely be looked at!

Please provide more context for your postings, and not just a link. Include all information people need to vote on inside your postings here on feedback.minecraft.net - not everyone can visit outside sites easily and be expected to come back and loan support to your idea.

Help your fellow community members make your ideas succeed by making it easier on them to vote. Feel edit your idea with all the necessary information.

Looks:


The red husk looks like this:

Drops:

  • 0-2 rotten flesh.
  • 0-2 pieces of red sand.
  • 5 experience. 12 experience will be dropped instead if the red husk was defeated as a baby.
  • 5% chance of a gold ingot.
Too easy to get.

Yes and the same with land mobs such as cows and pigs. They should run away more proactively to make it somewhat of a challenge to hunt them. This way, the player would need to learn types of strategy, such as ambushing prey. This would make even more sense with a new deer or goat mob.

Endermites are from inside the endermen's enderpearl / the inbetween the place enderpearls take you when teliporting (Hence the mite part.). Dinnerbone said something like that.
I haven't personally tried the happy ghast, but from many YouTube videos I know this complaint is not an isolated incident. I approve of these suggestions.

Ghasts should wait a second or two before flying away after luring. "mounting stage"

It's tricky to put a lead on a ghast, because every time you switch from a snowball to a lead it immediately flies away.

I also like the goat horn call because you may not be able to chase after your ghast trying to get its attention.

Absolutely.  The new wolf sounds are grating; they're also inappropriate in most contexts.  Wolves (and dogs) communicate with various sounds.  They don't just whine and yelp at random.  Not only is it super annoying, but it breaks immersion.  I'd rather the sounds be reverted to the previous sound set, or remove them entirely.  This update makes me not want to keep wolves as pets anymore, which makes me really sad.  :(
agree, as someone who has a trauma response to dogs growling, the new sounds are so stressful. would really appreciate a way to turn this off!!

im so glad im not the only person upset about this, i literally had to stop playing the newest update on Java because of it. It's really distressing because some of the sounds make them sound like they're in pain??  Which is really not great. Microsoft/Mojang please can you have an option for original sounds?

I finally started playing 1.21 and.... I don't like the new dog sounds at all.. I mean, they are good sounds in and of themselves, but, my dogs are constantly arfing and barking and growling and whatever constantly, all the time..... It's severely annoying! I usually take a couple of dogs with me caving to handle skeletons and now I'm just getting aggravated by all the barking and snuffling noises. It is WAY TOO FREQUENT. I couldn't find a way to minimize the amount of sounds they emit, only a way to turn them off completely, which isn't what I want. I like a calmer ambience, this is well.... stressful!

I’ve been a minecraft vet since beta testing, and I have to agree with you! I cannot stand the new wolf/dog sounds! I only have three in my base and they constantly sound like they’re whimpering in pain, they have full health though! I think I’m gonna end up taking them to a different chunk and making a house for them. It’s super annoying to take a perfectly fine mob and make it go from a fan favorite to something I’ve seen many many complaints about. Mojang L. Listen to your customers guys!

That would only be fair, just changing their wool color depending on the biome is weird, since this is still the same sheep, just with a different color. That's why I think adding a variant is necessary.
It seems to make more sense for it to perish when the heart is destroyed, since it is entirely controlled by that life source. It wouldn't be alive without a heart.
The sniffer is a dinosaur mob. But more of that would be so cool!

You know what, this is quite a neat starting point for making Minecraft's first melee combat, skill focussed boss, something which this game with its two ranged, flying damage sponges could really use. 

I'm just going to assume a flat, circular arena covered in soulfire capable blocks here, for a lack of better ideas.

Phase 1 is incredibly straightforward, featuring two telegraphed moves: a sweep with overhead twirl telegraph, evaded by jumping, and a sideways twirled upwards cut, which can be sidestepped. It may summon souls as well; living straightline projectiles, that bypass all physical barriers, countered by sniping them during chargeup. Also, projectile spamming the boss quickly causes a reaction move, which has him race towards the player and hook the blade around them, requiring a trickily timed blind jump to avoid.

Phase 2 causes the boss to flare up with soulfire and incorporate the blue flames into most moves: the sweep trails embers, acting like a lingering potion of fire, which can only be avoided by a well timed jump opposite to the swing's direction, and the upwards slash gains extra, flaming reach, punishing backsteps. Summoning souls simply summons more, disrupting the player longer. A sort of super move exists, a two-sided, vertical flourish setting up harmless ember walls and a spin into a sweep turns the air above the blade into the only safe zone.

Worth noting is, that the Soul Reaper's scythe breaks blocks it slices through and disables shields like an axe.

The boss drop is the one thing here, I am finding a hard time imagining how it could fit into the game properly. The themeing of the boss and just the whole idea of a scythe as a weapon requires a design, that would instantly feel over the top in a player's hands. Not to mention, that Minecraft is primarily meant to be a sandbox, meaning boss loot needs to have worthwhile sandbox implications, like the wither's nether star beacon and the enderdragon's outer end access and all the goodies that can be found there. So instead, let's make something more utility focussed, but still soul related. A soul crystal, for example.

This item would be somehow incorporated into the Soul Reaper's design and in the player's hands, it may prove surprisingly versatile. For starters, it could be a portable xp bank with an incredible capacity, allowing players to trade xp back and forth through it. That functionality would take up its right-click functions. On left click, then, it saps xp aka souls from anything it hits, one xp at a time, killing any entity with 0 xp remaining. Against players, it instead saps whole levels. Shift + left-click, meanwhile would spend a banked number of xp to send out a soul projectile, much like the one described in the other comments, which forcibly infuses souls at range, turning undead into temporary allies, passifying neutral mobs, healing passive mobs and dealing irresistable damage to players, but giving them the xp of the soul bolt.

It would kind of lead to the sniffer replacing the llama caravans in terms of mount-based, larger scale mobile storage, but considering no one uses llama caravans in the first place, this seems like a solid replacement.

Considering the adult sniffer's size, I would expect 2 double chests to fit on its back.

Sniffers could be able to hold up 256 items (which is 2 double chests of maxed amount of items and tools)! An adult sniffer would be a good pack animal, especially when moving large quantities of items from one place or base to another such as items in mob farms and player-made structures & houses!

Almost nobody uses llama caravans, and sniffers would be a better option, since they are coming back from extinction and you can have and store as many items as you want on them!

I totally agree. Imagine how cool it would be if a player was riding one and had another 5 sniffers behind him to move a lot of items. 
Since they're slow they wouldn't replace horses or donkeys. Also they would not replace shulkers. That makes it a great mechanic for 'early' players to move items

It would make for some heavy grinding to get both goat horns and the time to gather a few Minotaur horns that control of a Ravanger seems like a fair price.
